intro: Tofieldia glutinosa, commonly known as sticky tofieldia, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, sunny to partially shaded habitats, often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Tofieldia glutinosa is known for its sticky secretions on the stems and leaves, which give it its common name.
